parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Groups

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Order the given unit(s) to target the given target (via the radio). Command given to the player, puts a red square with words Target and Distance on player's HUD at target location. If player in vehicle and has radar facilities, it also adds target marker to the radar.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit [[commandTarget]] target

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> target: [[Object]] or [[Array]] of [[Object]]s

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_ESoldier1 [[commandTarget]] _WSoldier1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[commandTarget]] [ted, bill];</code>

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> This command is only effective when used on local units. When used on a remote unit, this command will create radio dialogue on the machine the unit is local to, but the unit will not target the target.

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[assignedTarget]], [[doTarget]]
</value></part></template>
